Instance.description: Represents the gameplay tuning associated with a region.

TunableList.name: compatible_venues
TunableList.description: A list of venues that are allowed to be set by the player in this region.

Tunable.description: A venue that the player can set in this region.

TunableEnum.name: default_outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: The default outfit category to set on the played Sim if they were in an invalid outfit category for this region when they were last saved.

TunableVariant.name: fishing_data
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define all of the data for fishing locations in this region. Only used if objects are tuned to use region fishing data.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a FishingData tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: Tuned fishing data for a particular fishing location.

TunableList.name: possible_fish
TunableList.description: If the Sim catches a fish, we'll pick one of these based on their weights. Higher weighted fish have a higher chance of being caught.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a total multiplier value based on tunable tests.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: possible_treasures
TunableList.description: If the Sim catches a treasure, we'll pick one of these based on their weights. Higher weighted treasures have a higher chance of being caught.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a total multiplier value based on tunable tests.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of tests and multipliers to apply to the weight used to determine if the Sim will catch a fish instead of treasure or junk. This will be used in conjunction with the Weight Junk and Weight Treasure.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of tests and multipliers to apply to the weight used to determine if the Sim will catch junk instead of a fish or treasure. This will be used in conjunction with the Weight Fish and Weight Treasure.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: luck_option_config
TunableTuple.description: The luck specific data for this option.

Tunable.name: player_perception
Tunable.description: The player's perception of the option, from -100 to 100. For example, if a sim is fishing, pulling up a boot would be seen as -100, while pulling up a treasure chest would be seen as 100.

Tunable.name: show_impacts
Tunable.description: If luck influences the selection process and selects this option, and this bool is True, then we will telegraph that impact to the player. An example of when to turn this off is for 'do nothing' options, where we don't want the game to say 'luck chose something!' but nothing visibly happened for the player.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of tests and multipliers to apply to the weight used to determine if the Sim will catch a treasure instead of fish or junk. This will be used in conjunction with the Weight Fish and Weight Junk.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a FishingData tuning snippet.

TunableList.name: gallery_download_venue_map
TunableList.description: A map from gallery venue to instanced venue. We need to be able to convert gallery venues into other venues that are only compatible with that region.

Tunable.name: gallery_venue_type
Tunable.description: A venue type that exists in the gallery.

Tunable.name: region_venue_type
Tunable.description: The venue type that the gallery venue will become when it is downloaded into this region.

Tunable.name: is_persistable
Tunable.description: If true, we will create an instance for this region and save/load it. The instance has a commodity tracker which can be used for region based commodities.

Tunable.name: is_summit_weather_enabled
Tunable.description: Whether this region has summit (EP10) weather enabled.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_category_restrictions
TunableTuple.description: A setting which specifies which outfits Sims are able to have in this region.

TunableTuple.name: allowed_outfits
TunableTuple.description: The outfit categories that are valid for this region.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableVariant.name: required_outfit_category
TunableVariant.description: If set, when a playable Sim spawns into this region, they are granted an outfit in this outfit category if they do not have one set.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Defines the way we generate the required regional outfit for this region.

TunableVariant.name: generator
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A helper that generates outfits for a Sim. The tunables control aspects of randomization, such as tags, weights, overrides, etc...

TunableList.name: blocked_tags
TunableList.description: The set of prohibited tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must not match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: body_type_chance_overrides
TunableList.description: Define body type chance overrides for the generate outfit. For example, if BODYTYPE_HAT is mapped to 100%, then the outfit is guaranteed to have a hat if any hat matches the specified tags. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated, regardless of their percent chance.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The chance that a part is applied to the corresponding body type.

TunableList.name: body_type_match_not_found_policy
TunableList.display: Body Type Match Not Found Policy
TunableList.description: The policy we should take for a body type that we fail to find a match for. Primary example is to use MATCH_NOT_FOUND_KEEP_EXISTING for generating a tshirt and making sure a sim wearing full body has a lower body cas part. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated.

TunableList.name: filter_flag
TunableList.description: Define how to handle part randomization for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The set of tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: The outfit category that is required for the region.

Tunable.name: travel_groups_only
Tunable.description: When set, this applies only to Sims in travel groups.

Tunable.name: provides_sunlight
Tunable.description: If enabled, this region provides sunlight between the tuned Sunrise Time and Sunset Time. This is used for gameplay effect (i.e. Vampires).

TunableList.name: region_buffs
TunableList.description: A list of buffs that are added on Sims while they are instanced in this region.

Tunable.description: A buff that exists on Sims while they are instanced in this region.

TunableEnum.name: region_currency_bucks_type
TunableEnum.description: If this is set to INVALID, this region will by default use Simoleon as currency type. Otherwise it will use selected bucks type as currency type.

Tunable.name: region_icon
Tunable.description: Thumbnail image of the region.

TunableEnum.name: region_type
TunableEnum.description: The region type for this region. Keep in sync with UI region tuning in Tuning->ui.ui_tuning->UiTuning->Pack Specific Data-> [Pack] -> Region List -> region type

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The parameter that we wish to change.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of the different seasonal parameter changes that we want to send over the course of a year.

TunableEnum.name: season
TunableEnum.description: The Season that this change is in.

Tunable.name: time_in_season
Tunable.description: The time within the season that this will occur.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value that we will set this parameter to in the season

TunableList.name: seasonal_sunrise_time
TunableList.description: A mapping between season and sunrise time. If the current season is not found then we will default to the tuned sunrise time.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The time, in Sim-time, the sun rises in this region, in this season.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableList.name: seasonal_sunset_time
TunableList.description: A mapping between season and sunset time. If the current season is not found then we will default to the tuned sunset time.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The time, in Sim-time, the sun sets in this region, in this season.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableList.name: snow_behavior
TunableList.description: Snow behavior for this location for the various seasons Defaults to NO_SNOW if not tuned for the current season If set to PERMANENT, it will also set initial water to frozen and windows to frosted

TunableEnum.name: value
TunableEnum.description: How snow behaves during this season at this location

TunableEnum.name: snow_behavior_no_seasons
TunableEnum.description: How snow behaves during this season at this location

Tunable.name: store_travel_group_placed_objects
Tunable.description: If checked, any placed objects while in a travel group will be returned to household inventory once travel group is disbanded.

TunableTuple.name: sunrise_time
TunableTuple.description: The time, in Sim-time, the sun rises in this region.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableTuple.name: sunset_time
TunableTuple.description: The time, in Sim-time, the sun sets in this region.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

Tunable.name: supports_lunar_cycle
Tunable.description: Whether this region supports the lunar cycle. This affects whether world environment effects are adjusted to the current lunar phase, and whether or not Sims that are instanced in this world are awarded lunar effects during lunar phases. For example, worlds that have two moons disable the lunar cycle.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: Tags that are used to group regions. Destination Regions will likely have individual tags, but Home/Residential Regions will share a tag.

TunableEnum.description: A Tag used to group this region. Destination Regions will likely have individual tags, but Home/Residential Regions will share a tag.

TunableVariant.name: tracked_terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: What terrain transitions should be tracked in this region. Used to tuned which terrains are important and exist in this region.

Tunable.name: travel_group_build_disabled_tooltip
Tunable.description: The string that will appear in the tooltip of the grayed out build mode button if build is being disabled because of a travel group in this region.

TunableList.name: weather
TunableList.description: Forecasts for this location for the various seasons

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The forecasts for the season by part of season

Tunable.name: weather_no_seasons
Tunable.description: Forecast(s) for this location for players without EP05 installed

Tunable.name: weather_supports_fresh_snow
Tunable.description: If enabled, this region supports fresh snow.

TunableVariant.name: welcome_wagon_replacement
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will replace the Welcome Wagon with a new situation. If the narrative is also set to replace the welcome wagon that will take precedent over this replacement.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The situation we will use to replace the welcome wagon.
